Container.Description: A PHP web-based interface for LDAP user account management and self-service password change.
Container.Name: ldap-user-manager
Container.Overview: A PHP web-based interface for LDAP user account management and self-service password change.

Config.Name: WebUI HTTP Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 80

Config.Name: WebUI HTTPS Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 443

Config.Name: LDAP_URI
Config.Description: The URI of the LDAP server. e.g. ldap://ldap.example.com or ldaps://ldap.example.com

Config.Name: LDAP_BASE_DN
Config.Description: The base DN for your organisation. e.g. dc=example,dc=com

Config.Name: LDAP_ADMIN_BIND_DN
Config.Description: The DN for the user with permission to modify all records under LDAP_BASE_DN. e.g. cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com

Config.Name: LDAP_ADMIN_BIND_PWD
Config.Description: The password for LDAP_ADMIN_BIND_DN

Config.Name: LDAP_ADMINS_GROUP
Config.Description: The name of the group used to define accounts that can use this tool to manage LDAP accounts. e.g. admins

Config.Name: SERVER_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: The hostname that this interface will be served from.

Config.Name: LDAP_USER_OU
Config.Description: The name of the OU used to store user accounts (without the base DN appended).

Config.Name: LDAP_GROUP_OU
Config.Description: The name of the OU used to store groups (without the base DN appended).

Config.Name: LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERSHIP_ATTRIBUTE
Config.Description: The attribute used when adding a user to a group.

Config.Name: LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERSHIP_USES_UID
Config.Description: If TRUE then the entry for a member of a group will be just the username. Otherwise it's the member's full DN.

Config.Name: LDAP_ACCOUNT_ATTRIBUTE
Config.Description: The attribute used to identify account usernames.

Config.Name: LDAP_REQUIRE_STARTTLS
Config.Description: If TRUE then a TLS connection is required for this interface to work. If set to FALSE then the interface will work without STARTTLS, but a warning will be displayed on the page.

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_CACERT
Config.Description: If you need to use a specific CA certificate for TLS connections to the LDAP server (when LDAP_REQUIRE_STARTTLS is set) then assign the contents of the CA certificate to this variable. e.g. -e LDAP_TLS_CERT=$(</path/to/ca.crt)

Config.Name: DEFAULT_USER_GROUP
Config.Description: The group that new accounts are automatically added to when created. NOTE: If this group doesn't exist then a group is created with the same name as the username and the user is added to that group.

Config.Name: DEFAULT_USER_SHELL
Config.Description: The shell that will be launched when the user logs into a server.

Config.Name: EMAIL_DOMAIN
Config.Description: If set then the email address field will be automatically populated in the form of username@email_domain

Config.Name: USERNAME_FORMAT
Config.Description: The template used to dynamically generate usernames.

Config.Name: USERNAME_REGEX
Config.Description: The regular expression used to ensure a username (and group name) is valid.

Config.Name: LOGIN_TIMEOUT_MINS
Config.Description: How long before an idle session will be timed out.

Config.Name: SITE_NAME
Config.Description: Change this to replace the title in the menu. e.g. 'My Company'
